Player History
Had first career hit on 4/3/1985, off Nolan Ryan (NYG)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/4/1985, off Mark Davis (NYG)...
Was selected to the 1985 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/10/1985, hitting .444 with 2 HR, 5 RBI...
Won Batter of the Month award on 8/1/1985, hitting .323 with 7 HR, 20 RBI...
Had 5 hits with 5 RBI against Texas on 9/13/1985...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/18/1985, hitting .400 with 3 HR, 7 RBI...
Won Gold Glove Award at Leftfield in 1985...
Drove in 6 runs against New York (G) on 7/5/1986...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/4/1986, hitting .375 with 4 HR, 8 RBI...
Injured on 3/17/1987 with a Broken Cheekbone, out for 5-6 weeks...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/1/1987, hitting .393 with 4 HR, 9 RBI...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/12/1987, hitting .522 with 4 HR, 9 RBI...
Drove in 6 runs against New York (Y) on 6/22/1987...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/26/1987, hitting .600 with 2 HR, 8 RBI...
Won Batter of the Month award on 7/1/1987, hitting .356 with 6 HR, 21 RBI...
Was selected to the 1987 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/1/1988, hitting .500 with 0 HR, 5 RBI...
Injured on 6/3/1988 with a Hyper Extended Knee, out for 1-2 weeks...
Signed as a free agent by Boston on 3/3/1990 to a 1-year deal worth $11,800,000 per year...
Released by Boston on 3/4/1990...
Signed as a free agent by New York (Y) on 3/4/1990 to a 1-year deal worth $1,084,000 per year...
Hit for the cycle against Boston on 4/11/1990...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/17/1990, hitting .400 with 3 HR, 10 RBI...
Traded from New York (Y) to San Diego on 7/27/1990 (Going to SD: LF Jim Rice. Going to NYY: P Bill Bene)...
Signed as a free agent by Pittsburgh on 2/27/1991 to a 1-year deal worth $3,100,000 per year...
